ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I learned a lot in programming, and not so much in statistical mechanics concepts.
Yes, it's a great course because of the teaching style and nice professor!
A helpful course. I would recommend.
It is a good course introducing statistical mechanics for people having some QM background.

This is a required class for PChem and Biophy Chem students. I think this is especially helpful for grad students. The class might not be the best but it sure provided a great chance to learn how to combine statmech with the research we might be interested in.
CHEM 530 is an important and useful class. Yes I would recommend it to other physical chemistry students, because it teaches you new concepts.
Yes I would recommend it because you learn the material in a very hands on way

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I believe it will help me with the rest of my graduate studies.
This course filled in the knowledge of studying thermodynamics in a bottom up way.
Learning how to use matlab and an idea about doing simulation could be valuable for future research.
I learned new concepts. It may be useful for my research in the future.
It allowed me to learn some programming and the application of modeling systems
